meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of saprozoic nutrition, in which organic matter is absorbed from dead or decaying organisms.
meanings.sent1: The saprozoic fungi thrive by absorbing nutrients from decaying matter.
meanings.sent2: The soil is enriched by the saprozoic process of breaking down dead plants.
meanings.sent3: The saprozoic bacteria had a feast on the rotting fruit, much to the gardeners' surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in a saprozoic manner, absorbing ideas from the past to create new ones.
meanings.sent5: The saprozoic nature of the compost heap attracted various insects and organisms.

meanings.definition: An organism that obtains nutrients through saprozoic feeding.
meanings.sent1: The saprozoic in the pond feeds on decaying leaves and organic matter.
meanings.sent2: A saprozoic like the mushroom plays a vital role in recycling nutrients in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The saprozoic scavenger was the hero of the forest, cleaning up after others.
meanings.sent4: She was a saprozoic, always finding ways to benefit from the waste of others.
meanings.sent5: The saprozoic creature was a silent but essential part of the food chain.
